Description: Textile fragment; rectangular fragment from one end of a linen cloth, medium quality, undyed but now greyish dark buff with darker brown-black stains (from oil ?). Across one end, the remains of a twisted warp-fringe, and at 4 and 4-6 cm in from the beginning of the fringe, two double continuous self-bands. Other edges torn. Worn. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spliced and S-twisted; the stitch gauge is warp c.22 ends per 10mm and weft c.12 picks per 10mm. The twisted warp fringe consists of 2 x (?) number of threads Z-twisted and S-twisted together. Textile was perhaps previously used as a tunic.
Condition: Poor: brittle where stained, much modern dust.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Dr Augustus Bozzi Granville
Acquisition notes: Wrapped, together with EA 75994-75996, in paper labelled in 19th century hand, 'Mummy Clothes various (No. 2)' and in pencil, 'Granville'. Probably from the mummy of Irtyersenu, unwrapped by A B Granville in 1821.
